Reviews.Title: “Adequate and met our needs”
Reviews.Author: MaraInTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (Sat.) as we had an early flight on Sunday. Hotels by the airport are always expensive and this one is too but there are a lot of pluses to this hotel: free airport shuttle starting at 5am onwards, suites, free parking, free WIFI, iron/ironing board, fully stocked kitchenette, LCD TVs. Yes, there is free breakfast but not when you have an early flight. Our 5th floor room was very quiet, room was an adequate size (though not as big as other Homewood Suites we have stayed in), & king bed was very comfortable. Strong water pressure & lots of hot water in the shower. There is a Starbucks and other stores/restaurants within walking distance (2 mins. drive away). The cons - the hallway carpet was dirty; the sleeper sofa in our suite was not made (and when I asked, the front desk said their staff does not do that!) and when we got downstairs at 5:03am on Sunday, the shuttle had already left even though I had called at 4:30am to confirm our departure. I got the feeling from check-in to check-out that the front desk staff are not service-oriented nor do they really care about their guests' experience. In the end, for one night the hotel was adequate and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Normally clean and comfortable...not this time.”
Reviews.Author: Stikym4
Reviews.Content: My family of four has stayed at this hotel at least 5 times since August 2011. The first few stays my only complaint would have to be the food at the complimentary breakfast. Not very good to say the least, but tolerable. The rooms have always been clean and quite comfortable; the staff has been accommodating. Our last 2 stays have left a bit to be desired. Our stay in January 2012, we had room 215. The door sticks making it difficult to get in. It is right near the conference rooms and extremely noisy if there are events taking place. There was a men's conference being held. Apparently the conference room wasn't open and hall was packed with about 50 men. My family had to wade through them to get to the elevator. Most of the men were considerate, but some made comments which made my wife and my 16 yr old daughter uncomfortable. Wanted to punch whoever said something in the face but, I couldn't tell who made the comment and it probably wouldn't have been wise to do anyway. I know that's not really the hotel's fault but on our next stay in March 2012, guess what room we got....again. You guessed it, 215. No men's conference, but a lot of traffic and the door still sticks. The absolute worst was there were bloodstained sheets on the hideaway bed. It was very late when we noticed it because we attended a jazz festival that evening. The front desk was responsive but not very apologetic. Clean sheets were brought to our room fairly quickly, but the damage had been done. Bloodstained sheets are a deal breaker for me. I'll find some place else to stay on on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option”
Reviews.Author: ericstm
Reviews.Content: This place is what you can expect from this brand. Nice room, nice hot breakfast, very good unexpected freebies and free Internet. Conveniently located near the airport with plenty of free parking places. The pool is ok but not more. The price is right and the personnel is friendly. Only thing is the wireless Internet provides very marginal signal in the rooms further away from the elevator. We had to use our Mac "hardwired" with an ethernet cable and create our own private wifi to have a reliable connection since we were in a corner suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families and Adults Alike”
Reviews.Author: Amy R
Reviews.Content: We took my 2-year and 5-month-old along on my husband's work trip. Based on his colleagues recommendation we stayed at this hotel and loved it! I was worried that being so close to the airport that it would be noisy as I am a very light sleeper. The rooms were sound proof enough that the noise didn't bother us at all. It was ideal for our family as our older child slept on the pull out sofa while the baby slept in a crib in the bathroom so we all had our own room and slept better. I would recommend staying on the lagoon side as the views were great and we were on the opposite side of the airport. We were impressed by the healthy breakfast options that included eggs, meat, fresh fruit, and homemade oatmeal daily along with the more commonly offered sugary options of waffles, cereals, breads, and pastries. Mon through Thu they also had a meal that included salad with beans and other main dishes with vegetables plus wine and beer. We went to the pool once or twice a day. It was basic but kept the kids happy. We were disappointed the hot tub was not fully heated the entire time we were there. I used the gym too. They had two treadmills, an elliptical, large ball, full weight set, mat, and medicine ball. Wish I would have brought earbuds to plug into the TVs while working out. The only other thing I would mention is the full kitchen did not include an oven as I bought food to bake in the oven. My husband's colleagues also enjoyed the place even though they weren't with their families. Overall we were happy and will plan to stay at Homewood Suites in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel !! excellent room !! outdated tv !!”
Reviews.Author: TheStarchild
Reviews.Content: wow !! excellent hotel near miami int'l airport !! spacious, clean, multifunctional room !! been there with my whole family !! can't wait to return there ....but please, update the tv's !!! outdated flatscreen tvs only !! very good hot breakfast on the house too !! so...enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Term”
Reviews.Author: Khirstin
Reviews.Content: For 18 nights, we spent 2300 dollars during high season from December 29 to Jan 15. I couldn't find one thing I didn't like about the hotel. The kitchen was good enough to make quite a few meals in. The bathroom area was big and I liked that it separated the bedroom and living room. The bed was awesome. It was big and comfy and so easy to sleep in. The closet was great, you could put a lot in there. The furniture was nice and the rooms are just so cozy. It was kind of like having your own apartment. The staff are friendly and the cleaners are awesome and nice. I liked that they offered not only breakfast but dinner as well. I don't know where else you can get that for the price. The location is right off Dolphin Expwy so you get places fast. Everything was great and I'd stay here again for a long term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Thea1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October b/c my husband had a meeting. It was close to the airport, had secure parking and an amazing breakfast buffet. The room had a dishwasher, stove, microwave, and refrigerator. The bed was comfortable. You would definitely have to have a car to stay here. The front desk staff were personable and even gave my husband a pair of flip flops for the beach and pool. The only negative was that the pool was very cold, as was the hot tub. Otherwise it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for 1 night's rest after long international flight”
Reviews.Author: Amaryllis2011
Reviews.Content: We needed some rest after being 14 hours in the skies and 20 hours in transit and before heading back home to Chicago. The hotel shuttle only showed up after calling the front desk twice. The check-in was o.k. The clerk invited us for a free light meal which we had missed just. We were however hungry and thirsty and had the choice of walking in the dark and unknown neighborhood 3 blocks in an industrial park or buy 2 bottles of beer and 1 bag of chips for $15. We (2 person) got an upgrade on our reservation with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a corner suite, which we did not need. The living room furniture was totally worn and filthy, the carpeting was damp from recent cleaning, I could not open the door into the bathroom without bumping it into the toilet. Totally exhausted we could sleep for several hours before the first planes took off around 4 AM. Breakfast buffet at 7 AM was o.k. but again the furniture worn and the ventilation in the hallways and breakfast area unacceptable. The elevators did not function properly and opened only after creaking horribly. I ran out to the shuttle as fast as I could.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Value”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May and September and it remains great value for money and very comfortable. A mix of tourists and business users stay here. It takes no more than 10 minutes from the Airport and you can choose a room at the back if you cannot cope with the aircraft noise , however we havn't found that a problem.The Managers Evening reception Mon-Thursday offers a light snack with beer and wine for free , ideal if you are just in and do not feel like looking for restaurants. Breakfast seems to get better each time we stay and its all in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but needs some work!”
Reviews.Author: Dive_Doctor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice location! Looking out your window and seeing the waterfront is a very nice touch. The rooms are nice, but in need of some work. I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. In one of the bathrooms, the door wouldn't close unless the toilet seat was raised and the extractor fan wasn't working. The amenities are great - free parking, free internet and complimentary wi-fi, breakfast included and use of the business center at no additional cost. I've stayed in other hotels near MIA and I've had to pay for every single one of the abovementioned, so definitely a plus for this hotel. Be warned...the elevators take a very, very, very long time to go back and forth! Despite the aged appearance, this hotel is still a very good deal. I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend to anyone around the airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites Blue Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Icg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. We had four people and reserved a two bedroom suite. The suite had a living room type area with comfy chairs and a small couch and a small kitchen with a table between the two bedrooms. Each bedroom had its own full bathroom. There was also an electric fireplace which was nice. Seems a bit unnecessary in Miami, though. There is a shuttle bus from the airport; I called for it after we got our luggage and the bus was there about ten minutes later. There is another Homewood Suites location nearby so be sure you get on the right shuttle. Check-in was quick and efficient. The lobby was nice. The suite was clean and in good shape. We could look one window and see the pool, another, the "lagoon". The breakfast was ok. It included some hot food, scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, pastries, juices, milk, coffee. I can't remember if they had the waffle maker. We arrived on a Saturday night so I can't comment on the evening meal. While you're at breakfast, be sure to step out on the balcony that overlooks the lagoon and check out the giant carp that swim over. Bring your room key or you'll need someone to let you back in. There aren't any restaurants in the immediate area so, being tired, we ordered pizza from one of the fliers that were left in room. There is a grocery store about a ten minute walk from the hotel if you need anything. My one complaint is that the walls are somewhat thin and because it's an airport hotel, people are coming in at all hours. Running water and cans tossed into wastebaskets from surrounding rooms are easily heard. Earplugs were somewhat helpful. Despite this, I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is good, but shuttle driver they referred is very Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Y C
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 2 days 11/19/2011, 11/20/2011. I booked this hotel after I read reviews on this website. The hotel is clean and 2 bedrooms-suite is very suitable for family stay. The staff is very nice. I called hotel in the morning of 11/19 before we took flight to Miami to ask for a suite facing the lagoon, not facing the airport. The staff answered they will try and could not guarantee. When we arrived in the evening, we got the suite facing the lagoon! The hotel shuttle is very good, we called hotel at airport and the shttle bus arrived at airport within 10 minutes. The staff is very polite and the breakfast is very good. Before I left I thought about recommending this hotel to my friends for their future stay in Miami. But the departure experience total destroyed my good feeling with the hotel and changed my mind. Here is the detail: On the day I checked out(11/21/2011) I asked Hotel staff at front desk to introduce some shuttle providers to me for transportation from the hotel to Cruise terminal. The Front desk staff referred only one shuttle provider (I did not remeber driver's name, is 'Alfaro' or 'Rodolfo', or something like that. But I do have his phone number:--) and this shuttle driver gave us very bad experience at the end of my stay at Miami and therefore totally destroyed the very good impression the hotel gave me during my 2 days stay. Before we left I talked to the driver at the hotel lobby. Our party have 5 adults and 2 children. The driver gave me the price is $10 per adult, no charge on kids. therefore total price is $50 dollars. We thought this price is O.K. At that time, one of 5 adults was at airport and we asked the driver whether it is O.K. for him to pick up the person on the way to cruise terminal(The hotel is very close to airport) and he agreed to do so but he did not told us there is extra charge for this before we took on the shuttle. However when we arrived at cruise terminal, the driver asked us to pay him $70 instead of $50. We were all shocked by his request and asked him why. He said that the airport charged him $20. I know this is lie since there is no such airport charge at all. we went with him all the way and did not see any airport personnel collect money from him. It is too ridiculous. This dishonest shuttle driver insisted on asking for $20 more dolloars from us and we had no time to keep on arguing with him.(We need get boarding on cruise ship, a cruise line personnel urged us to check-in our luggage. ) so I just gave him $20 to get rid of him. This was very terrible experience and shocked me a lot. Since this shuttle driver is the only one referred by hotel staff. This bad experience totally destroyed my trust to the hotel. I will NOT recommend Homewood Suites at Miami Airport to any person. My suggestion for future guests is doing homework (searching shuttle providers and taxi on the web) by yourself first and not just using the one hotel referred.

Reviews.Title: “Looked great, but looks can be deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: travelingraysgirl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night. I was already stressed as I had to leave a cruise ship in St. Kitts and fly to Miami and attend at the Miami children;s hospital for a medical emergency. Very stressful vacation. I had chose to leave the Ramada North airport hotel as there was issues with providing a mini fridge and baby crib that were promised at check in the night before. I chose to leave the Ramada and visit at the Hilton as they offered good rates for those that are in need of a hotel and got a discounted rate of $129 for having the list of hotels from the Miami children's hospital. When I arrived at the hotel I was pleased. Very nice hotel and a nice area. The front lobby was warm and inviting and well decorated. Upon my arrival to my room #618 I was very pleased. Everything was perfect and everything appeared clean. Separate bedroom area., large bathroom with separate vanity area, full kitchen (minus) an oven and separate sitting and dining area. Very satisfied at first. Then the smoke started to roll in. I knew when I took the room that it was a smoking room. I too smoke but take it outdoors. I felt like the occupants on my floor were smoking directly in my room. It was constantly smelling of fresh smoke, I opened the windows as far as they would allow 3-4 inches and had the drapes pulled back to allow for some fresh air flow. It didn't help. I started putting towels by the main front door to block the incoming smoke. It too did not help., turned on the fan above stove top to high and left bathroom vents running in hopes of ridding the smoke that seemed to enter our room. Still nothing improved. I have serious doubts about the ventilation system in this hotel as the smoke was overwhelming. On the 6th floor you get off the elevator and race to your room as it is sooo smoky in the hallways too. When I finally went to bed I still could not sleep, kept inhaling second hand smoke from an apparent chain smoker/smokers. It was disturbing me and I could not sleep. I got up to cover the vents with pillows and blankets in hopes to stop the awful smoke from entering our unit. Finally turned on light to do this and noticed bugs on the night stand. I lifted the corners of the mattress and voila there were critters there too. There were bugs on the mattress and on the bed skirt. Ewwww, called the front desk and he sent up security to take a look. Yes, the security man also seen the critters crawling on my bed. I also took pictures and videos which I will add in later. I was told there were no other rooms available and to call them back in a bit. I was in a panic freezing all my bed clothes and anything that was on the floor or near the bed in the full size fridge/freezer provided. Unfortunately this was around 1:00am. I began to research changing my flights and leaving all together for home. No avail, on that one. At around 3am the hotel front desk sent up the security to tell me they had found another hotel for the night for me. I took their offer and packed up the toddler and myself and left this hotel. The security drove the hotel's shuttle bus to the new hotel. The Marriot Spring Hill Suites. I did receive an apology from the gentleman at the front desk that evening of course, did not have to pay for the room itself. Although, the staff at the Marriott Spring Hill Suites were amazed they did not pay for my first night there as a result of the stress they put me under for staying in a bed bug infested room. I liked the feel of this hotel when I arrived. The front desk was warm and welcoming. Tastefully done and very nice, well appointed rooms with a great amount of space, but by no means want to sleep with critters. I am not a professional but they did appear to be young bed bugs.after researching the internet at length until it started to get spotty around 2am. I would stay here again ONLY if I was reassured there are no bed bugs in my room or throughout the building and if they made it a non smoking facility inside as I don't think their ventilation system works well enough to ensure clean air indoors. I did check out their pool area earlier, although I never used it it seemed rather plain in comparison to the hotel. Square, fenced in area at back of property. Didn't stay long enough to enjoy their complimentary breakfast! Won't be back until I KNOW nasty blood sucking bed bugs are eliminated and smoke free throughout entire hotel. I could have enjoyed this place otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Stay-Cation”
Reviews.Author: WD80
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to get away this weekend. We had a friendâ€™s 50th birthday party to attend and decided we would stay close by to be out as late as we wanted. Well, we dined, wined, and danced until about 10:00 pm, then we were done. Homewood Suites was a great idea. Because there are two separate rooms/suite, I was able to catch the last part of the LSU â€“ BAMA game while my partner crashed in the other room. I also liked there being a kitchenette area since we brought snack food from home that I was able to heat up on the stove top and put our fruit and couple of bottles of wine in the sizable fridge. For my partner, she likes staying by water and Homewood Suites accommodated up by giving us a room on the Blue Lagoon side. She loved the nice view, quiet, and especially the king size bed. The next morning, I got up early for the hotel full buffet breakfast. There was lots of variety from scramble eggs, sausage, French toast, fruit juices, baked goods, cereals, and of course coffee. The hotel must be kid friendly because there were lots of kids running around enjoying themselves and the food. Outdoors from the breakfast area, there is a patio where the kids were throwing bread to humongous carp. The carp would literally jump 2-3 feet to get at the bread before it hit the water. After breakfast, I checked out the internet in the business center. There were 3 computer but only 2 seemed to be working. It was a busy morning for the business center, so I did not try to stay long. Homewood Suites has a decent late check out, so I got a chance to get a short nap before leaving the hotel headed home. We had a relaxing and enjoyable time at Homewood Suites/Blue Lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: zlbenites
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. It is near the airport but there is no noise that can bother you. I stayed there last October 2011 with my husband on vacation. We were amazed by this hotel. The suite really big, comfortable, totally clean. The beds super comfy, clean, clean and clean. We had a very delicious breakfast and a delicious dinner. All free!! The ladies at the reception desk were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is near a supermarket, a drugstore and some small shops. It is sorrounded by a beautiful lagoon, totally relaxing. On my next vacations I am going back to this hotel. It was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bluealistair
Reviews.Content: Homewood suites provided an excellent service in keeping us comfortable in our stay, for providing transportation (whether thru their service shuttle or helping us get cabs), for a hearty breakfast and of course for having accommodating staffs. The area is quiet and secured plus we had a great view. The gym is not big but the equipment are quite modern and all in good condition, since i was the only one who used it at the time, i had a nice quiet workout time. There was a laundromat too which we conveniently used to keep us from bringing home loads of dirty clothes... I just also want to mention that a friend of ours who checked in to one of the popular hotels near the airport was actually surprised to know we had 2 LCD TVs in our room, as he only had a CRT TV on his room. Having good TVs was a plus for us as we end our day watching great plays! The only thing that disappointed us a little was the cost of grocery items in their hotel shop... although it is expected to be expensive, it was way too expensive, an example would be a bottle of Blue Moon Cost 5USD while we later found out that the grocery nearby sells 6 bottle of Blue Moon for only 6 USD,,, oh well, charge to experience. =) Another thing is, if you want to go to South Beach area or the other main attractions in Miami (going to the North / South of the airport)... cabs are really costly... it will be a lot better if you rent a car (if you drive of course) All in all we had a comfortable stay at Homewood Suites Blue Lagoon. We will definitely stay here again given the chance to be back in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “IÂ´ll be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liylly
Reviews.Content: Great Homewood close to the Airport!!!The rooms are large,very clean and comfortable.The furniture is wasted ,but well kept.Breakfast is very good!!!And the Blue Lagoon view is great!!! The staff is really nice,Pam and Linda did a great job in Front Desk!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ximena C
Reviews.Content: Very nice to stay, confortable, you can feel at home, nice area, very relaxing enviornment and so close to the airport. I loved to be there specially with two kids you always have to clean lots of laundry and in this hotel you can do it very confortable and any time. You have breakfast every day and you can find dinner service monday to thursday, very confortable to stay there and enjoy while you relax close to the lagoon or the pool. Easy Internet conection and also you can order food from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Big, clean rooms close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: hblil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 1 night when we arrived in Miami late at night. The hotel was close to the airport. Convenient - but a lot of noise from the planes as expected. We had a suite with two bedrooms (upgraded from 1 bedroom suite), two bathrooms, a livingroom including a kitchenette. The beds was comfortable, and the room was clean. The room was a little out of date- but it did not matter because it was well maintained. The breakfast was OK - but not more than that. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you are flying out of MIA”
Reviews.Author: StephandJohn32244
Reviews.Content: we stayed here the night before we flew out to St. Thomas. We used our Hilton points so I don't really know what the room rate was for the night. It's in an average neighborhood. I didn't feel okay walking in the parking lot at night but that was just me. If you need anything, there is a Publix supermarket about two blocks south on the main road to the west of the hotel. This hotel is refurbished. It has been here a while and you can tell. The hallways are outdated, the carpets aren't the greatest, and the elevators at the ends of the halls are a little scary. Take the main elevators in the center of the hotel. The morning breakfast is pretty good considering it is free. You can tell that the hotel staff takes a lot of pride in it. The front desk staff is very helpful and polite. There is a shuttle that can get you to the airport and pick you up when your flight arrives. However, the drivers aren't always polite so you might have to cheer them up a little. The best thing about this place is you are very close to MIA. The worst things about it: it's outdated and nothing decent (restaurants) is anywhere close.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sloopie1
Reviews.Content: My family (5 adults & 1 child) flew to Miami the day before our cruise. This hotel came recommended on Cruise Critic's review boards. As I used my Honor's points, this hotel was a natural for us. I booked 2-1 bedroom suites but requested an upgrade to the 2 br if it was available. They picked us up at the airport and took us to the hotel where we were upgraded. Nice. The 2 br is 1 king & 2 queen w/2 bathrooms, kitchen, livingroom, & a queen sleeper on the living room. 3 tv's complete the rooms. Room was immaculate and the beds ultra comfortable. The Hotel shuttle will take you to any restaurant within a 5 mile radius at no charge and I highly recommend the Cuban restaurant in the Publix shopping center. Absolutely delicious! The hotel will also contact an independent shuttle service that will take you to the cruise terminal for only $10 pp & no chg for the child. The hotel couldn't be more accommodating. A delicious free breakfast (hot) buffet is just the icing on the cake for this hotel. The next time our travels take us to the Miami airport area, you can be assured we'll stay here again. You definitely will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money Spent.”
Reviews.Author: gwmadrigal
Reviews.Content: I went on a family vacation for five days four nights and I would comeback to this hotel. I stayed at a 2 bedroom suite that included 2 full beds, 1 full kitchen, 1 sofa bed. Upon arrival I was assigned to a room that had not been cleaned yet. I called the front desk and within 15 minutes I was reassigned to another room. I read some past reviews complaining about old style TVs, during my stay I can report that the room had two very nice LG 40 some inch LCD Tvs. They must have been renovated recently. The kitchen includes a medium sized refrigerator, microwave oven, dishwasher and a 4 burner top stove. The kitchen is fully equipped with dishes. There were no issues with noisy rooms due to air traffic from the airport. We slept comfortably every night. Breakfast included scrambled eggs, warm ham slices, sausage, potatoes, yoghurs, fresh fruit, several choices in bread with toasters readily available. French Toast, Pancakes, Orange, Pineapple and Apple Juice, Individual Cereal Boxes and all kinds of milk. Coffee. I really didn't miss Embassy Suites breakfast. Staff was very friendly. The only thing that I didn't like and didn't give the hotel five stars is the fact that the pool was outside of the hotel, had salt water and was not sparkling clean. Advantages: Central Location in the City No Parking Fees Safe Area Full Breakfast Complimentary Dinners Served Monday to Thursday that include Drinks. Clean Rooms Service Includes Pool Disadvantages: Not suitable for guests without cars. There are no places to go to within walking distance, except for a Burger King. For my needs, this hotel met my expectactions very well. I was looking for a hotel that offered breakfast as part of their stay for a party of five. I went to the beach, the seaquarium, airboat ride, downtown shopping, dining. Cruise for a day. If I was to come back to Miami for another vacation I would stay again for the same price or a little bit higher than what I paid. I recommend this hotel for those people looking for ways to save.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place-boring area”
Reviews.Author: jeninin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night before coming home. I chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and it was a Hilton (points). Check-in: Quick and easy. Hotel: Overall it was your average hotel-nice, simple and quiet. Room: Decent size, kitchen, separate bedroom-nice. We had a view of the lagoon (small lake). I didn't really check out the property much. I did notice a pool. It seemed small and typical for this type of hotel. Beware: of the pizza advertisements. I think we got 5 different advertisements that were slipped under our door. The front desk said do NOT use any of those companies. They have had many complaints about them. Stick to the norm and use a large pizza chain that you know. The area was the only thing that really bothered me. There was nothing really close by to do. There were a couple of malls, but it was kind of a pain to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: didi_dabest
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers very good value for money. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was much better than other hotels I've stayed at. The front desk staff were wonderful and the shuttle service was very good. There is also a shuttle to dolphin mall that passes right outside the hotel. The decor is not modern but the service and facilities compensate. Parking and internet were free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money!”
Reviews.Author: H2OTGP
Reviews.Content: Oue party consisting of two couples stayed here on the 12th May prior to joining a cruise the following day. Our flight from the UK got us into Miami in plenty of time to arrive at the hotel in time for the " Managers buffet " This was excellent and superior to other Homewood suites we have stayed at in Orlando. We had a two bedroom suite on the top floor overlooking the lagoon. I could not fault the suite and did not think it was looking tired as others have said! Ok the TV wasn't a flatscreen but for a short stay who cares! The Breakfast was also excellent. if you are looking for a good value , clean and comfortable hotel near the airport in Miami this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller from UK
Reviews.Content: This was about our 6th time staying at the homewood Suites Blue Lagoon Drive. We spent the first night of our holiday there after flying in from London. Check-in was quick and easy. We had booked a two room suite and apart from the fact that it was really hard to open the bathroom doors as both doors hit the toilet seats ....the suite was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Unfortunately, for the first time, we experienced dreadful aircraft noise. We had a suite at the front of the hotel, at the end of the building looking onto the swimming pool. Perhaps the location on our suite was the problem? The noise went on well past midnight and started again very early in the morning. The compementary breakfast was very acceptable with plenty of choice. The hotel is very good value for money and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: ScubaCoupleRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this homewood suite as we had an overnight layover at Miami. The Shuttle service to and from the airport was quick and easy. The front desk service was great, they where very friendly and helpful. The hotel rooms needed some updates. The rooms were very big and the beds where comfortable but many of the items in the room where worn down and needed to be replace. The Ottoman had tears in it and the sofa had stains. The bathroom shower drained very slow. It was not the worst place that I have stayed in but probably the worst Homewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: dancingprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise. We arrived at the airport and caught a cab to the hotel ( $15 with tip) as we didnt have a phone to call their shuttle and couldnt see it anywhere. We were warmly greeted by the great staff and were told all about the free dinner that night and the free breakfast the next morning. We had a 2 bedroom suite with a king bed in one room and 2 double beds in the other room. Very spacious and comfortable for the 5 of us. Dinner ( spicy little prawns and free beer and wine)was had out the back of the hotel overlooking the lagoon. THere were turtles right there which the kids loved. We also went for a night swim and it was great. We didnt hear any airport noise and the front desk went out of their way to organise transport to the cruise terminal the next morning. I would definetely recommend this hotel if you need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “just ok.”
Reviews.Author: TucsonBillnange
Reviews.Content: Can't complain too much as we stayed a night before and a night after our cruise at the expense of our son's Hilton award points. We also used frequent flyer miles from United to travel to Miami from Tucson so our only real cost was for our cruise to the Caribbean. The hotel picked us up from the airport with their free shuttle in good time. It is a good distance from the cruise port but closer to the airport. We spent $10 per person for the shuttle to the cruise port and the same on our return. The hotel is ok but could use some renovation. The rooms were large and comfortable but a little dated and the noise from the nearby airport was quite noticeable. There is a free, unremarkable breakfast available but we were a little turned off by the fact that one of our party was a couple of minutes late the morning before our flight home and was told there was nothing available, not even a piece of toast. We mentioned this to the front desk personnel who was apologetic and offered to get something from the kitchen, a nice gesture. I wouldn't say that this hotel lives up to the reviews we read and relied on when we chose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Property is tired.”
Reviews.Author: SRQtravelqueen
Reviews.Content: A group of girls stayed in a 2 BR, 2 BA unit for 2 nights. We overlooked the pool on the 5th floor. Each night there were groups of people sitting near the pool under our bedroom...talking and enjoying the way after midnight cool air. They were just having fun but the noise came up and disturbed our sleep. Feel sorry for the guests on the 2nd, 3rd & 4th floor! This hotel was renovated 5 years ago (as told by a desk clerk) and is in needed attention. The couch is soiled and sags. Older TV's, a freezer that didn't freeze & saggy mattresses. But there was a good selection of bed pillows, so every choice is available. The bath vanity was adequate, separate from the potty and shower, but the faucet spout was short and barely cleared the back of the sink. Breakfast is included, but very ordinary. Awful scrambled eggs. Good thing shredded cheese was next to the chaffer. Close to the airport so very convenient, but know you will also hears the planes taking off.

Reviews.Title: “Hits on All Cylinders”
Reviews.Author: GPSguyAustin
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally well managed, pushing the envelope of just how good this class of property can be. Friendly, professional staff, from front desk to shuttle driver. Pristinely clean rooms and public areas reflect managementâ€™s commitment to maintaining a superior property. Complimentary shuttle for destinations within a 2-mile radius, including MIA International. Evening (M-Th) â€œManagerâ€™s Receptionâ€� included complimentary beer, wine, and a light meal on par with the best casual dining restaurants. Even more amazing, an actual manager was present, overseeing the event and properly playing meet & greet. Excellent quality, too, of complimentary hot breakfast. Spacious â€œsuite designâ€� rooms include studio-sized living area, fully separated from bedroom/bathroom. Great bedding with plenty of pillows. Generously sized bath towels, better than in some 4-star properties. 9â€™ ceilings make rooms feel even larger, and easily accommodate shower head (excellent) mounted high enough for all heights. Free High Speed Internet (wired or Wifi) another plus, with servers sized to handle the load. Only minor annoyance was slow elevator service, under-engineered in the building's design. No worries. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: lucky_charm2300
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. The suites were standard, with a king bed, living room and fully loaded kitchen and bath. The pool was nice, with a whirlpool as well. Fitness centre was also one of the better ones I've used. The business centre was great, they even had pens, paper etc. so I didn't have to search for anything. Best part was the breakfast and dinner. Breakfast had standard cold cereals in addition to fresh fruit, juice, breads/bagels for toasting plus hot food (eggs, bacon and potato pancakes) waffle makers were also brought out a couple of days. Get there early as people tend to hoard the fruit and they don't refill it that often. They also offered a "dinner" in the evening - hot food such as meatloaf and potatoes, salad, etc. Also included beer and wine. They put a calendar on your fridge with each night's dinner menu. Great value - you could conceivably not spend any money on food if you stay here. There was also a tuck shop with many things, so you really don't need to leave the hotel for anything! They also provide a shuttle to the airport. Be kind and tip the driver as he's lifting your bags, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our purpose”
Reviews.Author: meren
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a good hotel, with comfortable nice rooms, with a kitchen and a living room with sofa bed. Breakfast was included and it was really complete. We stayed just one night on our way back to Argentina.It is close to the airport. It has a free shuttle to it and a taxi to Dolphin Mall is about u$20 for 5 , so you donÂ´t need the shuttle that cost u$10 per person. The only negative thing but it isnÂ´t really from the hotel are the menues in the room, from two restaurants, horrible food!! and you have to pay the taxi for the delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Lhwebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites Blue Lagoon for a pre-cruise stay with our two teenage daughters. We were greeted by the staff and treated very well. I asked for a particular location in the building and I was accomodated. They were serving a free evening buffet when we arrived which worked out great! It was nothing fancy but hit the spot just fine. Our room was extremely nice and comfortable. We were in a 2 BR suite which was perfect for us and our teenage girls. They also enjoyed the outdoor pool. Breakfast the next morning was very good with a variety of choices. We are loyal to the Hilton family of hotels because of the Hilton Honors program. This was one of the better stays we have had and we will look here first the next time we're in Miami. I missed the name of the nice lady at the front desk, but thank you for starting our trip out right!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT ROOMS @ EXCELLENT PRICES”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: When we go to Miami is all about shopping, so we need a spacious room. Besides, being a family of 4, it is really great to have two rooms, one with a queen bed and the other with 2 individual beds. It has a complete kitchen so you can have dinner comfortably. They should work on room's TV (it is from artic age and has a VHS!!!) and the pool area is not really inviting. Breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Every Respect!”
Reviews.Author: sleep7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August of 2010. We were bringing our daughter down to the University of Miami. The hotel was fabulous. The rooms were spacious and clean. The free breakfast had great choices and delicious coffee. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the parking was free. What more could a traveler want? GREAT STAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Twrichards
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location pre-cruise with two other people. Booked a two room suite. Had been traveling since 3am and was really looking forward to checking in and taking a nap. Attempted to check in at 2:45 PM. (Check-in is at 3). The room wasn't ready but was told to come back in 5 to 10 minutes and it would be. Went to lunch and came back thirty minutes later (3:15) and the room was still not ready. Came back at 3 (After their check-in time) and the room was finally ready. Got all my stuff in the room, walked into the bathroom and was surprised by a puddle of water on the floor. Looking up at the ceiling, water was pouring in from the bathroom fan. Called the front desk and was told they would send housekeeping up. Fifteen minutes later I called back down after a no show and was told they were working on a new room. Was moved to the room next door. The room next door had issues as well. The door knob kept falling off the main door (probably a fire hazard) and one of the bathtubs wouldn't drain. The food for dinner and breakfast wasn't all that great and the wine at the dinner was the worst I have ever had. I have always been a big fan of the Homewood Suites and enjoyed staying at their hotels, but I would have to rank this as the worst one I have stayed at. I would stay at a Homewood Suites again, but definitely won't be staying at this one. I would look elsewhere if staying at the Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome! Stop the hating!”
Reviews.Author: hapitrvlr
Reviews.Content: My stay was due to a group cruise I arranged for 65 people (6/28/10). I booked 16 rooms and the staff, hotel and surroundings were perfect! The breakfast is fine and there's a shopping center with a supermarket and several restaurants; CVS & Walgreens are all within walking distance. If you have a car, the Wal-Mart is not far (about 10 min). Free airport shuttle and they recommend Alfaro Limos/Shuttles for trans to the Port (Rodolfo was/is very nice & accommodating!). Although the Hotel is close to the Airport, I hardly heard the planes. However; if you can, request the lagoon side to be sure. They even allowed my group (up to 10 cars) to leave our cars for the entire time we were on our cruise @ no charge! I totally recommend this Hotel for a family and definitely a Group! This place is awesome! Stop the hating!

Reviews.Title: “"NOT A HOTEL MORE LIKE A MOTEL"... says my 11 year old”
Reviews.Author: fee319
Reviews.Content: The room was very small (we got the two full size bed room) batHroom was too tight..The hotel needs updating REALLY BAD. I booked this hotel because of the free parking and free breakfast everyone raved about!! BIG MISTAKE!!!!!! Thank goodness I only stayed here two nights.None of the staff spoke english except for customer service at the front desk. OH AND to get to the pool you have to walk outside the building and around the corner.!!!!!! IT'S SAD THAT I COULDN'T WAIT TO WRITE THIS REVIEW BECAUSE I HAVE NOT EVEN CHECKED OUT YET! OH YEAH and the breakfast in nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Worn Out”
Reviews.Author: Katchapuri
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th time to stay in this hotel for an extended period (2-3 weeks). The hotel is located near our place of work in Coral Gables and b/c we are HHonor Diamond members it makes sense to book it, rather than the nearby HIlton for the extra space, free breakfast, evening reception and parking. This time we had a two bedroom suite, which we got at an excellent rate, however we were disappointed with our overall stay. It is all the little things that add up and make the difference between a great stay and a frustrating stay. I think the problem at this property is with management and their lack of communication. While the staff are all very friendly, especially the food service staff and housekeeping, nothing gets done and the upkeep on this property seems to be lacking or on a 'as need basis'. For example, our dishwasher was leaking all over the floor, yet it took 4 phone calls, over 4 days to get it fixed and the first person they send said it wasn't broken, despite water all over the floor! Eventually, two men worked 2 hours on taking it apart , while we were in the room, but we weren't offered an apology by management or any follow up. The plug on the drain in one of the sinks didn't work. I reported tthis 3 times....nothing. The dust bunnies in the corners of the rooms were disgusting and never did get cleaned up over the two weeks we were there. The panels around the light switches were grubby. There was mould on both shower heads, which I cleaned myself. I asked for extra hangers and eventually on day 3 got them. I know the hotel staff is busy, mainly with guests who are there on a short term basis usually coming or going to a cruise, but not cleaning the room until 2-3 pm each day is not acceptable. I realise these are all small things, but they add up and make an overall impression. If we weren't HHonor members, we would probably stay at the nearby Hyatt Summerfield Suites. I don't think it would take much to get this Homewood Suites back up to par----some refurbishment before it falls apart and proper management would help. As I said, the staff are certainly willing but I suspect very overworked and doing the best they can. Come on Hilton, hire more employees, pay them more and ask yourself, 'would Paris stay here? (I think not :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good value on a two-bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: flyflynn
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to spend the night after an evening airport arrival. We wanted a place that had two bedrooms so that we wouldn't have to share with our kids. This place was perfect for us. They had microwave popcorn in the kitchen, so we made some, watched a cartoon movie on cable, went to bed, and woke up in the morning and took advantage of the free breakfast buffet. The only pool is outdoors, so unless it's toasty out don't plan on swimming. Free shuttle to and from the airport; when you land and get your luggage you just have to call and tell them you need a ride. Free internet was nice since we had our laptop. Planes weren't loud even though we were near the airport. Rooms are quite clean and well maintained, though not perfect. I had to laugh because our bathroom door didn't close unless you had the seat up. The blackout curtains aren't set against the wall, so some light streams in on the sides. The pool looked like it needed to be cleaned, but I think it had stormed that day and it was much too cold to go swimming anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 616 if non-smoker”
Reviews.Author: Bretttski
Reviews.Content: If you say non-smoking these days, this shouldn't mean it just doesn't have ashtrays...Â  With no other "non-smoking" rooms available, this room, billed as a non- smoking room, and a few others on the floor are on the smoking floor. Â What this means is your clothes will smell like a smokers when you hang them up overnight, you will feel like you actually smoked in the morning with a headache to boot. Â  There are guarentee signs all over the hotel impressing their goal is your satisfaction, but in reality the front desk was only guarenteed to say sorry - have a good day there is nothing he could do. Â  This room also is out of range for the free wifi. Having stayed more than 30 nights at this property in the past and enjoyed all aspects of the hotel as other reviewers - this stay was a huge dissapointment. Non-smokers beware!Â

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leftthedog
Reviews.Content: Called for the free shuttle from the airport and they were prompt in pick up. Room set up worked well for us. The bedroom is seperate so my husband could get up and work in the living room in the morning while I slept in and got ready for the day. We could hear the planes in and out despite my sound machine but it didn't bother us too much. The dinner that is available Mon- Thurs was good and while not gourmet hit the spot. This saved us from having to leave the hotel for dinner after a long day of travel and that it was included in the price was great. Breakfast was hot and good enough too. The free shuttle also dropped me off at a pharmacy and picked me up when I was done the next morning. Couldn't really ask for better service for a place to sleep near the airport. The only negative was the toilet was not set properly on the floor so it sounded like it was breaking every time you got up off it and the toilet lid was the thinest plastic I've ever seen. The hotel arranged a shuttle service take us to the pier in the a.m. for $25 for 2 people. We would stay here again for a night pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “We certainly got our moneys worth and more, we are happy patrons.”
Reviews.Author: qohphoto
Reviews.Content: We found the room to be beautifully decorated, very clean and modern. We got exactly what we requested. Although it was too cold in Miami on the date of our stay, the pool and hot tub looked wonderfully inviting. The continental breakfast that was included was the most elaborated breakfast that I have ever encountered. The food and service was wonderful and the lobby was gorgeous, lots of parking and we thought there would be noise from the neighboring airport but while we could see the planes, we certainly couldn't hear them. The room was spotless and equiped with everything we could have imagined. The next time we bring friends or family to tour Miami, we will definately stay here again. Can't wait......

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Miami frequently and have stayed at many hotels. We were just passing through and looking for something close to the airport; and this property was a great price. It is pretty new (or a recent renovation), a great location (10 minutes from the airport) the rooms are spacious; everything we were looking for. Breakfast was hot with plenty of options. Being close to the airport you need to expect some noise, but otherwise it was great. There appeared to be a lot of pre/post cruise guests, and I expect it would be an excellent choice for that. Overall, I would stay again when looking for something close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “after cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: bama_gurlGa
Reviews.Content: this was better than i expected. this stay was great. the room was wonderful i will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: kthy66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days over Christmas prior to our New Years Cruise. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is conveniently located near many stores including CVS, Publix and Walgreens to name a few. We were a group of nice. Others in our party had the 2 bedroom suites, we had a single bedroom suite which was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the kitchen was well appointed. We were able to take advantage of the managers reception one night for the free dinner and it was surprisingly good. (The reception is only Monday thru Thursday) The free hot and cold breakfast every morning was terrific. The dining area was large and well layed out. The pool and hot tub were clean and well maintained. We utilized the outdoor patio area and grill for our Christmas dinner and have no complaints. We spent sometime out on the patio feeding the turtles and the huge fish! I would advise that if you are a light sleeper to request a room on the lagoon side since there is some noise on the airport side. We were on the 6th floor lagoon side and had no airport noise but 4 of our group were in a 2 bedroom on the airport side and did say they had some airplane noise. We were also able to park our car there for free the week we were cruising, thats a score since they charge $20 p/day at the Port of Miami. We ate dinner out one night at the 94th squadron restaurant and it was the worst food I have ever had... definitely avoid that place.. Yuck! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: InfreqFlyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our daughter, and my sister stayed in a 1 bdrm, double bed suite (#221) pre-cruise Nov 26-29 and 1 bedroom, king bed suite (#616) post -cruise Dec 6. They were roomy enough and we made use of the stove to cook 1 meal. I recommend staying in the odd number suites which does not face the airport, and lower levels. The Nov stay was great, the jet noise was not noticeable. However, when we were on the 6th floor room after the cruise, you'll know you're near the airport. But it's to be expected since you're staying near the airport. This is a hotel that does not charge for parking, as I didn't want to pay $20-30/night for parking downtown for the car I rented. While some complained about the complimentary meals, we thought they were great freebies (Thurs evening reception with wine and hot entre & Fri-Sun breakfasts, including fresh fruits for 3 of the 4 days). We did notice not all of the lamps worked, one didn't have a light bulb, but other than sleeping, bathing and cooking 1 meal, we were hardly in the room so no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value/ great place”
Reviews.Author: diani55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites the night before and the night after a cruise. We needed two bedrooms and two baths because we were traveling with our adult daughter and her husband. I checked many hotels in the area and it was very expensive to get two seperate hotel rooms with the amenities we like to have at our hotels. My husband and i stay in Homewood suites when ever we can. The staff was helpful and professional. They helped us get transportation to the port. They allowed us to check in early both days. The price was great. Beds were very comforable. The room was clean. They had a very nice breakfast both mornings that included sliced fresh fruit, eggs, all kinds of breads, meat, as well as your usual continental breakfast. There was a hot tub and pool. The driver even dropped us off at a restaurant and offered to pick us up for no charge. We really like Homewood Suites and this one was just as nice as all the others we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Mcjesuss
Reviews.Content: We went into a shopping trip to miami, and stayed at Homewood Suites by Hilton Blue Lagoon, in a 2 bedroom/2bathroom suite for 4 nights. What I can say is that the hotel, as well as the staff, acomplish exactly what they are supposed and expected to do, nothing more and nothing less. Spacious and clean rooms, great complimentary breakfast, good free parking and the most important: The whole crew is very polite and discrete. I recommend and definetly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Argie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 different times in this hotel and I'll stay again on my next trip to Miami. It's just a great hotel. Rooms: I've stayed at a 1 bedroom suite with sofa and the size is perfect for 3 persons. Nice bathroom, big kitchen area with everything you need to cook a meal. The bedroom had a king bed and was great. Breakfast and evenings meal: The breakfast is complete with fruits, yoghurts and hot things also. But one of the best things about this kind of hotel is that Monday-Thursday they serve an evening homemade meal. Location: Although is far from the beach and next to the airport, you're 15 minutes away from South Beach. Bedrooms with an airport view will trouble you with the runaway noise, so ask one with a lagoon view. Service: Excellent, everytime I needed something for the room I got it in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “For a business or extended trip - this should be your first and ONLY choice!”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: We had to be in Miami for ten days, and none of us could imagine being stuffed into a regular hotel room for that period of time. Knowing that the rooms are like apartments, we chose the Homewood Suites - but the way this particular one is laid out, stands above the rest: In a Typical Homewood layout, there is the living area, then a door and the bedroom, with a sink, and the commode and shower separate. However, here, there is a sink in a foyer BETWEEN the living and sleeping rooms, and a separate tub and toilet. One can have visitors, and keep the sleeping area completely separate. They went out of their way to ensure we were all on the same floor. The free wired and wireless internet, as well as free parking were quite welcome. Just across the main street (NW57th ave), there is a Publix Supermarket and a host of restaurants, and even an office supply store. There are pharmacies (CVS and Walgreen's) just one block further. The hotel is easy to find - and in fact is visible from 836. It is just a short 3-5 minute drive from the airport (and it appears as though they have a shuttle, although we didn't use it). The breakfast and dinner, while not culinary extravaganzas, were adequate, and for the price (free) we weren't complaining. The refrigerator, microwave and stovetop in the room were quite handy. Within 10 minutes of the place were: The Airbus Training Center (our destination), a FedEx Kinko's, several malls, Coral Gables (dining, shopping), the aforementioned supermarket and drug stores. Within 20 were: downtown, the cruise port, Miami Beach and Costco. Lest you think I'm biased: there were things that could use improvement -- my room had several burned out lights, the ceiling fan was so noisy that I couldn't sleep with it on, and the air conditioner was on it's last legs. I did NOT report these issues because I had precious little time in my room, and did not wish to have maintenance banging around, nor did I want to move after unpacking. However, I prefer a property where Quality Control is managed properly, and these items are addressed before a guest checks in. None the less, this is a solid B+ property, and I can't think of any place else I would rather stay if I had an extended visit to Miami in the future. One other thing that I did not like - each night menus from local delivery places were slid under my door. Seemingly innocuous, but what this tells me is that non-guests are roaming the halls fairly freely. There is a security there, but perhaps it's time to put card readers in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Overall Ok Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler09
Reviews.Content: Good overall hotel. Close to the miami airport (about a $10 cab ride). The inside of the hotel is comfortable and home-like. Staff support was average. Breakfast was good and there are lots of tables to eat at. Overall a nice place to stay near the Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price for Miami”
Reviews.Author: tink360
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre- cruise, having never been to Miami before. I had the local number for the hotel in my cell, that is important because there is no phone at the airport to request a ride to their hotel. The first room we were given was not great, it smelled and didn't have the view of the water we had requested. I called the front desk and they changed our room to right across the hall, this room was nicer & had a decent view of the water. There was a small sitting area in the room with a couch & tv, and a separated bedroom with 2 double beds, a small kitchenette & a decent bathroom. The kitchenette was nice, had a fridge, a pantry with plates & silverware, coffee maker, dishwasher, microwave. The only negative as far as cleanliness goes was the glasses, & utensils. I would definitely run anything through the dishwasher before using it - the glasses were not clean & after that I didn't trust any of the dishes. The utensils had crud on them & obviously not clean. The fellow who picked us up from the airport did not seem to speak English, and seemed to be in a foul temper. In the daytime, the van driver was pleasant & very helpful and took me to the local mall to shop for pre-cruise items & then picked me up promptly when I called. This is a great service, if you don't have a rental car, because the hotel is out at the airport & not close to much. I was able to buy some items I forgot to pack at a Publix, bought some alcohol at a liquor store, and had a manicure at the same mall. The liquor store was the only down side - none of the bottles were marked with prices, and they wanted to charge me the same price for a small bottle of Baileys as a large. I had the feeling there are prices for obvious tourists such as myself, and fair prices for locals. As far as the staff goes, the front desk people were very helpful & the only unpleasant person was the guy driving the van the night we came from the airport. Maybe he had had a bad day. The breakfast in the morning was great, the room packed but the food was good & plentiful, with a great variety & good quality. The staff were great - my son did not get up in time & they helped me find a tray so I could bring food up for the both of us to our room. Couldn't ask for more really in terms of a nice & helpful staff. We got a great price for a hotel room in miami. We did not arrive in time to sightsee the night before our cruise, so the out of the way location was not a problem. In the morning the driver of the van the front desk helped arranged to get us to the port was very nice & no problems with our transportation. The free high speed internet was a nice touch too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: fraugast
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom suite at this hotel because we wanted a spacious accommodation close to Miami Airport. Upon arrival we were offered a free upgrade to a two bedroom suite. The suite turned out to be extremely spacious, more than enough for a family of four. The suite consists of one bedroom with two queen beds and another bedroom with one king bed. Each bedroom has an ensuite bathroom. The bedrooms are separated by a living room with kitchenette. The kitchenette is extremely well equipped, you could cook a four-course meal there if you felt like it. Unfortunately, there are only two chairs at the big living room table and the other persons have to sit on the sofa, which makes eating a bit uncomfortable. But that's the only drawback of the suite. Otherwise it is perfect and all is very clean. The free breakfast was of average quality. Nothing to write home about, but you won't leave hungry. The stuff is friendly and helpful. We didn't use the pool but looking at it from the window of our room, it did not look too appealing. The pool was full of leaves and seemed to be quite dirty. However, the pool area is nice and there is a big gas BBQ. There is no restaurant in the hotel or in the immediate vicinity. You will need a car to get some food. There are a Publix supermarket and some fastfood restaurants in about 3 minutes driving distance (I would think 15 minutes walking distance, area seems save). Driving time to the airport/rental car stations is about 10 minutes maximum. Even though the hotel is just outside the airport area the rooms were very quiet and the planes barely audible. Overall it was a pleasant hotel experience and we will certainly stay there again on our next visit to Miami

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable, but bring your own groceries.”
Reviews.Author: kkmonga
Reviews.Content: Our suite was immaculately clean, the kitchen well supplied, and the bathroom, though small, was also very clean. Beds were outfitted with premium linens and a comfy pillowtop mattress. We arrived on an evening flight and asked about food delivery. A local restaurant had flyers at the desk. After a comedic battle to place an order with a gentleman who obviously knew English as a second (or third?) language, we waited over an hour and a half for our order which was to arrive in 30-40 minutes. After 3 phone calls to check on the order (one which was answered simply, "We close") the order arrived, half of which was incorrect and all of which was nearly inedible. At breakfast, we were starving, as were many, many people at the free buffet. The employees obviously did not expect many guests to eat there, because they ran out of everything within 15 minutes, and placed semi-frozen food on the buffet ("use the microwave") and we were left with little more than coffee and Fruit Loops. I loved our room and would stay there again, but would make a trip to the grocery beforehand!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohninDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to cruising. The hotel shuttle picked us up within 10 minutes, but then did another lap looking for more passengers. Our room was great - small kitchen and living room and a bedroom. Based upon suggestions from the front desk we walked two long blocks (less than 10 minutes) to a strip mall with a grocery store, liquor store, and several dining options. Breakfast the next morning was above average for a hotel and we enjoyed the pool and hot-tub for an hour or so before checking out and catching a cab to the port. If you arriving too late to enjoy Miami, and checking out the next day, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGal02
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites at Miami Airport's Blue Lagoon was a great spot and we had a pleasant experience there. We had a roomy suite which was very quiet, comfortable and spacious. The hotel van came within ten minutes to pick us up - but note that at the hotel telephone bank in the luggage pick-up area, this Blue Lagoon site has no direct phone line. However, there is a Homewood Suite phone number indicated for one of their other Miami properties, and using this number, they were able to transfer us over to the Blue Lagoon site's front desk to send over the van. One issue to note: this hotel has NO restaurant in the hotel or anywhere nearby (although they had a lovely free breakfast set-up). Thus, you have to eat at the airport or elsewhere before your arrival. HOWEVER, on weeknights they apparently offer a free dinner (one nightly menu per weeknight) to their guests - but the dinner has a narrow timeframe (somewhere around 5:30 to 6:30 pm). We arrived much too late to sample the free dinner. Otherwise, we have no complaints about their very comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: stablewalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, Mon to Thurs am. Nice suite, very clean with good kitchen (microwave, dishwasher, fridge, waste disposal). Breakfast good, dinner adequate. The one complaint we have is that this is the only hotel we have stayed in where we have been charged to use the in-room safe, this is petty and money -- grabbing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre Cruise Choice”
Reviews.Author: Romnan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Homewood Suites as a pre cruise selection. We try and do this because for the price of the room for one night we can park the car for free for the duration of the cruise and don't have to deal with the port parking garages There is a shuttle right to the port for a nominal fee and once the cruise is finished all it takes is a cab back. The price is about the same. The Hotel is also close to the Miami International Airport The hotel is well worth the money spent very large king size bedroom,with a living room thath has a couch that was almost as large as the bed. Televison in both.In addition their is a full kitchen. We went to the local super market that truthfully you could walk to if needed (about 8-10 blocks) or a short drive. picked up what we needed for diiner. There was the market,a liquor store bank, ets.etc. Continental breakfast which includes eggs bacon, sausage and other good eats is included in the price. All and all for the price you really are getting a great bargain

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: We arrived around 3pm and checked in without any wait. They have luggage carts available in the lobby to use. I didnâ€™t receive my Hhonors Gold benefit (2 bottles of water and a package of cookies), but thought nothing of it because some hotels have it waiting in the room, and others deliver it a couple of hours after you check-in. I never received it, so I checked the next day and the reception person was not very friendly. She insisted that if my gold status was on my reservation I would have received it. Well it was on my reservation (shows up when they give me my invoice) and I didnâ€™t. She told me to grab a (one) bottle of water from the little shop. If you are entitled to any free items, please make sure you get them when you check-in. The cost of these items is not much, but I mention this because I think the hotel nickels and dimes you (see safe info below). ROOM: The bathroom was between the living area and the bedroom, and there were doors to each entry. This was good because my sister was on the sofa bed and didnâ€™t need to go into the bedroom to use the bathroom. Also, the toilet and shower were separated from the bathroom sink by a door. The toiletries in the bathroom were Neutrogena brand and consisted of; shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a shower cap. There is a TV in the living area and in the bedroom. Pay Per View movies were available. There is also a VHS player in the living room (yes, VHS). There was a safe in the room that uses a key. You have to go to the front desk to get the key, pay a refundable $15 deposit and pay $1.50 per day to use the safe. I donâ€™t think I have ever paid to use a safe at a Hilton property, even in hotels in New York City. Also, there was nothing that told you this in the room; I went to the front desk asking about the safe key and was told the policy. DINING: The free breakfast buffet was not as good as other Homewood Suites locations. It was enough to save the cost of buying breakfast, but I wouldnâ€™t pay to eat it. LOCATION: The hotel is right next to the airport, which is conveniently close, but also loud at times. We were in a room that faced the airport and could hear airplanes occasionally, depending on the runway they used.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: tripper80
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night pre-cruise. We booked this hotel for three reasons. First, the free airport shuttle, Second, the complimentary breakfast and Third, the suite accomodations. The free airport shuttle was disappointing. We called to request the shuttle once we had landed and retrieved our bags. The receptionist said the shuttle would be there in 15 minutes. That was great - we had arrived 6.5 hours delayed due to weather an just wanted to settle in. We were told just to wait outside the departures. I had hoped that there was a designated pick up/drop off area. I was right in hoping so. In short, we saw the shuttle drive right past us after over 20 minutes of waiting - the driver didn't even look our way. I tried to chase after him to no avail. After three more calls to reception, the shuttle finally came to our rescue. The driver was very helpful with bags etc. It turned out that they had picked up another party and taken them to the hotel. They had thought it was us, only realizing that it wasn't us because we kept calling. Yes, it was a misunderstanding but there has got to be a better system in place. It should not take over an hour to get picked up by an airport hotel shuttle. That said, the room was nice-sized, updated, comfortable and clean. The suite was great for us and a toddler. The crib they provided was waiting for us in the room (thankfully - as we arrived past 11pm). The man-made lagoon outside is a really nice touch for an airport-hotel. It was nice to sit out there. The breakfast was ample and pretty edible. The breakfast area was spacious with adequate seating and a high chair for our needs. The very large aquarium in the lobby is also very nice. We took a cab to the port the next day, it was about 30$. I would stay here again. But I would be much more careful and specific with the shuttle arrangements when I call.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms bad service”
Reviews.Author: Galapagoslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice but service terrible: -The housekeepers use the same elevator as guests and the push every floor as kids to get down so elevator are to their service no to guests, it takes you more than 5-10 minutes waiting for elevators. -I had to check out and check in for an award stay, and Aida Venegas at the front desk keep chating on the phone with her friend for 10 minutes by clock, then she ask for the imprint of certificate, is the only hotel has done that, I want to get it and told her that she wanted this only to be able to keep chating with friends, when came back the manager was mad due to my coment to that employee His name Franz Fernandez. They do not understand that they are in the service industry. -I asked for the internet access code so I wont be incomunicated, they said for some reason did not have it, had to wait againg another 10 minutes for Franz. -The toilet was leaking water 3 days already and they have not fixed. -The AC control box is out of battery has not being changed

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAnn
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night following our flight from London. We were given a two bedroomed suite which we didn't really have time to appreciate. Clean ,very comfortable and well situated this was a great place to stay and so reasonable. 11 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Marleneb
Reviews.Content: We had a very early flight from Miami airport and decided to stay the night at a hotel and leave our car. The suite was very nice and they served breakfast ( we left too early to have it) and a very nice light dinner with wine! The shuttle to the airport at 6 AM was fine and they picked us up at 2AM we we got home. We also got to leave our car in their parking lot for 10 days free. The price was about $125.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Toni3452
Reviews.Content: Only 1 night before taking a morning flight to JFK. Excellent impression. Pros: 1) quick check-in, 2) very close to Miami airport, 3)complimentary shuttle to MIA, whose service was excellent (only 10 minutes wait), 4) small but nice and clean pool, 5) great price deal and above all 6) one of the largest hotel rooms we've ever stayed, with 2 separate big areas (one for the kids and one for us), with 2 big individual bathrooms, a coimplte kitchen, 3 Tv sets, etc.. Superb room !! Cons: 1) Location: If you don't need to be close to the airport, you are in the middle of nowhere, far away of Miami's main attractions / poins of interest and 2) Sorry again, but breakfast was very poor, with not so many options and closing at 9,30 h. ??

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: extraextra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at five different hotels in different parts of Florida and this was the best hotel we stayed at. This hotel was a lot better than some of the more expensive hotels we stayed at. We stayed here on the first and last night of our trip because it was close to the airport. The room was clean and large and came with a separate bedroom and a living room. The kitchen had a microwave, stove, and was fully equipped with silverware, refrigerator, plates, pots and pans, etc. The hotel itself isn't stunning, but everything is functional and clean - there is a laundry room, a computer room, a small store, and a fitness room. There is a Publix and a strip mall about four blocks away. And all the people at the Front Desk were really nice. Compared to some of the tired, dirty hotels we stayed at at other places, this one was a gem.

Reviews.Title: “STOLE MY RUM”
Reviews.Author: nicehotelbadpeople
Reviews.Content: It was my second time at AT HOMEWOOD SUITES, BLUE LAGOON. Clean hotel, nice suite,well equipped, breakfast SO SO, but eatable etc. The day i checked out i left a gift (TWO BOTTLES OF DOMINICAN RUM) with a guy at front desk and told him that i friend will pick them up , i even put them in a brown bag and the employee gave me a letter size paper were i wrote the name of the person that will be picking up the bottles of rum, he went inside the little office and said ok , have a safe trip back home, i travel back to the Dominican Republic and three days later my friend calls me and says that there is no rum at the front desk . I contacted the manager whos name is Gody Almonte (SHE EVEN CALL ME TO MY CELL IN THE D.R.) and told me that she will investigate . UNTIL THIS DAY NO WORD ABOUT THE STOLEN BOTTLES OF RUM AND THE MANAGER DOESNT RETURN MY EMAILS ASKING FOR AN EXPLANATION. MY CONCLUSION: HOTEL GOOD, EMPLOYEES PARTNERS IN CRIME.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & suite”
Reviews.Author: tingles
Reviews.Content: Booked on Tripadvisor recommendation as part of our 3 and half week tour of Florida, we stayed here on our first and last night. This hotel is a gem if you want to just chill out on your first night after a long flight, you donâ€™t even need to go out to eat as the welcome home dinner is fantastic. We expected it to be a snack but it was soup, a salad bar and hot food with free drinks for 2 hours, what more could you ask for the price! The rooms are excellent, nice and comfy and we had a free upgrade on our first night to a 2 bedroom suite which was huge. The hotel is a bit out of the way from everything but we booked it for its convenience to the airport which is a 5 min drive away. SoBe is only a 15 min drive and 2 great malls are the same distance in the other direction. Hotel staff were very helpful and we could not fault anything. The dinning area overlooks the lake as does the pool and there are giant fish which come up to the patio looking for food. The pool and hot tub are good overlooking the lake but you have to put up with the planes overhead because its so near the airport. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: citizen_of_earth
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel with clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. Great service through highly personable staff.
