Provides free airport shuttle, cable tv, breakfast daily, newspapers and high speed internet access. Close to Miami airport. 15 mins from Dolphin Mall 20 mins from Biscayne Bay 20 mis from Coral Grove 30 mins from South Beach 35 mins from Bal Harbour You WILL enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerryGibeault
Reviews.Content: We stayed the first night on Hilton points for a one-bedroom suite, but were pleasantly suprised to be upgraded to the 2 bedroom suite. The following 4 paid nights had been booked for a one bedroom but the hotel kindly let us stay in the 2 bedroom suite. Nice touch. Very nice breakfast spread each morning and Mon-Thurs they put on a light meal/beverage( wine & beer) service. We found it to be very satisfactory for our evening meal. Even though it was close to Miami airport, we barely noticed any noise. The adjacent Dolphin Expressway takes you right out to Miami Beach, but we found it somewhat congested one afternoon rush hour coming back to the hotel. Excellent, well-managed property- I'd certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value huge room.”
Reviews.Author: liptont
Reviews.Content: We were six friends going on a cruise and arriving the day before. Everything about our stay was excellent except for the airport shuttle. We waited over 45 min for the shuttle. If we knew we would have to wait that long we would have been happy to pay for a cab! The hotel is only about 1 1/2 miles from the airport ... The rooms had kitchens, living room, table and chairs , and a seperate bedroom. The hotel served a buffett dinner pasta, salad bar, soup, bread, plus free beer and wine .. it was not too bad like a hospital cafe... They also have a huge breakfast included Dinner and breakfast for 6 in Miami is a huge bonus ! The room was very clean and in brand new shape. Wired and wireless internet was free in the room and they also had a Bus. Center with 3 pc and a good printer all free... It was nice to just pay the one price and be done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: endOfPath
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a few friends for the Miami Half Marathon. This hotel is a very easy 10 minute drive from the start of the race. We had a suite with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms and a full kitchen. Everything was very clean, checkin and checkout was smooth, the free breakfast (eaten after the race) was excellent. Unfortunately there were some loud guests or pool crashers around 1:30-2:30 AM that interrupted my sleep. I believe that they were kicked off the premises. I can't blame the hotel for this incident. I'd gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suites at this hotel..!”
Reviews.Author: ecu_traveler
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel, for overnight stay, very near the airport. Also suitable for longer stays, if you dont mind staying near the airport. Suites are big, modern and very confortable. Its a bit expensive ( $160/night), its worth for family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed at several Homewood Suites. I would say this was the most disappointing of the lot, possibly because it is older. It is handy to the airport and there are an assortment of chain restaurants reasonably near by. The shower is good, with good quality towels. Chairs and sofa are comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed for a light supper. It was fun watching/feeding the turtles and fish in the lagoon behind the breakfast lounge. However, the bed linens are thin and the mattress not very comfortable (in contrast to a Homewood Suites near us - I would love to buy their mattress). We couldn't shut the bathroom door unless we left the toilet lid seat up, zero clearance otherwise. Internet access was down during our entire stay. The hotel is not well-insulated; you can definitely hear the airplanes across the way. Our bill for a one-bedroom suite for one night was $300 after tax - no way was this hotel worth that much!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louder72
Reviews.Content: Convenient location - close the airport, and several restaurants and stores are close by. Parking is free, the suites are nice, and housekeeping was good. The breakfast was not spectacular but ok. It is in a business park, so there isn't much to do in the immediate area if you're in Miami for tourism. I can't say that I was awestruck by this hotel, but I had no complaints about it either. There are definitely worse choices you can make for accommodations in Miami. The suites are very nice for the price; many Miami hotels charge much more for a room than you will pay here for a suite. I had no problems with my stay here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good locale, Decent rooms, Bad airport transfer”
Reviews.Author: whereyagoing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before leaving on a 16-day trip abroad. It was a Hilton chain hotel, and it allowed us to leave our car for the duration. The room/suite was clean, though small, and adequate. It provided the extra space for comfort that suites generally do, though it is by far smaller than an Embassy Suites property. The breakfast was adequate and fresh. The evening (Mon-Thrs) reception was jammed with guests and the food was so-so. They actually provided a meal, not just chips and dip. But the quality was mediocre. Our main issue was not in getting to the airport from here - that was easy. It was getting there from the airport. They are not on the hotel board! So finally we called the nearby Hampton to be connected to the Homewood. Then we were given an 866 free number to call. Great - try to find a payphone at the airport these days! Eventually found one, and the driver drove us not straight to the hotel but to some staff's home because the guy did not drive! More delays - taking us well into rush hour in a nerve-wracking traffic area by the airport! For this reason alone, I cannot recommend the hotel. How can a hotel NOT be on the airport hotel board? How can you not take travelers (we had flown for 12 hours!) straight to a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Very New, Excellent Airport Access”
Reviews.Author: negoti8or
Reviews.Content: When we arrive from South America to Miami with the kids, our first wish is to get out of the airport and into a nearby hotel to decompress and make the segue into vacation mode starting the next morning. The Homewood Suites was a fantastic place for us (4 adults + 6 kids) - the two 2 room suites we had were appointed with full kitchens, making the warm milk routine very easy. The hotel and the rooms all appear very new, no worn down carpets or sagging sofas. We opened the drapes to find a fantastic view of the lagoon complete with jet skiers, that was nice. But funnily enough, the best part was the shuttle service. Ask at the front desk where a good place for dinner can be found, and if you're lucky (as we were) a Cuban driver named Alain will show up to take you directly to a nearby Cuban family restaurant that's packed with locals and perfect for anyone wanting some local flavor. The hotel not only dropped us off, they also came back and picked us up! What great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: janabm81
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 children, mother-in-law, and I stayed here after our cruise. Compared to the hotel we stayed in before the cruise (beach place towers marriot in ft. lauderdale) the homewood suites was a dump. For starters we booked a two bed room suite for privacy and because of the fact that there were 6 of us but the walls are so thin that it wouldn't matter if we were all in the same room or not as far as conversational privacy goes. At night I could hear the people's next to us converstion and they weren't being loud at all, it sounded like normal small talk. The next thing is the elevators. Not only do they take forever but the bell sounds like a sick cat and the way it jerks around you've got to wonder when the last time it really had a matinence check was. I tried to look at the certificate inside the elevator but the date was covered by the "frame" they'd put it in. Next was the god awfull smell of smoke that permeates the whole place. We were supposed to have been on a non smoking floor but how strong the smell was you couldn't tell. (I'm a smoker by the way) Lastly, the "breakfast" offered in the morning was the most dissgusting thing I've ever tried to eat. The "eggs" were liquidy and lumpy, the sausage didn't look done, and the juice was very very watered down. I finally settled on frosted flakes with almost room temerature milk. Needless to say, I would not recomend this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: OnyxTM
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stay here on May 5th. before heading out for our cruise out of Port of Miami which is about a 15 minute taxi ride from the hotel. The cost for the taxi was $22 The hotel is very clean & safe. The hot breakfast was very tasty. This hotel will go out of their way to please you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: memberCuracao
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in september and it was more than we expected. First of all I searched a lot of hotels in Miami before i made my choice. Tripadvisor came in very handy with all the helpful reviews posted. On the hotel website we found a great deal so i booked it immediately. When checking in, the frontdesk officer told us that there is a problem with our booking and that they are going to fix it. Well did they fix it right. We got a 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms (beautifully furnished) a nicely equipped kitchenette and adjoining livingroom. All this for $99,- p/n. tip: it's good to be a Hilton honors member.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites Miami-Airport / Blue Lagoon
HotelInfo.Address: 5500 Blue Lagoon Dr, Miami, FL 33126
